His Majesty’s Ambassador, should be V'i- fc addressed 'Leeper Prodrome, Cairo”, ^ I am, Sir, I am directed by the Secretary of State for India to forward for the information of trie Government of India, a copy of a letter from the Foreign Office, regarding the tablishment at Cairo of Government, It will be seen that telegrams intended for Mr, Deeper, VW\ Your obedient Servant, H. A. F. KUMBOLDon this subject, please quote In any further communication Sir, I am directed by Mr. Secretary Eden to inform you that, as the result of the transfer to Egypt of the King of the Hellenes and the Greek Government, His Majesty’s Embassy have been established at Cairo. Certain of His Majesty’s Representatives abroad have accordingly been instructed that telegrams intended for Mr. Leeper, His Majesty’s Ambassador, should be addressed ’'Leeper Prodrome Cairo”. 2. I am to suggest that the Secretary of State for India may wish to take similar action in appropriate cases. recd. pat- I am, Sir, Your obedient Servant -3 MAY Under-Secretary of State India Office.(k) Cover for Enclosures in Weekly Letter No. P.Z. dated from Secretary, Political and Secret Department (External), India Office, to Secretary to the Government of India, External Affairs Department. 6448 Wt 21725/P 139 1000 9.37

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 2367/43 'Establishment at Cairo of H.M. Ambassador to Greece'

physicalDescription.extent: The file's contents are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of two letters between the Foreign Office and the Government of India's External Affairs Department discussing the appointment of HM Ambassador to Greece as a result of the King of the Hellenes and the Greek Government transferring to Cairo.
